result.execSummary:
The defendant Megyn L Schmitz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Megyn L Schmitz is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Megyn L Schmitz was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens

Must comply with Mental Health Regiment.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
CASES: 14CF345, 14FO638 Defendant Megyn L Schmitz in court with attorney Shelly Tomtschik.  Daniel Joseph Tolan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  KJB- Clerk. 9:17am Def- plea of G to Ct 2. CT accepts plea, finds G, enters JOC; DRI Cts 3 & 4, dismiss outright Ct 1 and all of 14FO638. 

SENTENCING on Ct 2 in 14CF345: w/h sent, prob 1 year- appear today, no fine imposed, 25 hrs of CS where she is placed, comply w/MH regiment. Def eligible for expungment after successful completion of probation. 9:26am adj.
Preliminary hearing on December 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on December 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.

2:24 Defendant Megyn L Schmitz in court with attorney Shelly Tomtschik.  Daniel P. Steffen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  JP-clerk  Per DA - Officer is sick and will not be able to attend hearing.  Would like to reschedule.  Per PD - would like felony dismissed.  Ct - adjourns to be rescheduled by Br 1 to accomodate ST's schedule.  2:28 adj.
Preliminary hearing on November 24, 2014 at 02:15 pm.

11:45 Attorney Shelly Tomtschik in court.  Stephen C. Dorrance appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Megyn L Schmitz not in court. JP-Clerk. Prior to going on record.  DE is in day treatment, no one made arrangements for her to be here, feels they were confused with a SCC case .  ADA agrees to rescheduling.  Ct - reschedule with JA to schedule PH.  11:47 adj.
Defendant's - Submitted by Public Defender Tomtschik
Preliminary hearing on October 27, 2014 at 11:30 am.
Report in support of probable cause for arrest. Request for criminal complaint

Other: Follow all recommendations of Health Care providers and take and prescriptions at prescribed doses. Must live at Schlegel at foster home and be in compliance w/SC County dispo order.   Must appear at all future court appearances.  Defendant shall give written notice to the Clerk of this Court within 48 hours of any changes of address or telephone number.  Not to commit any new crimes.

Defendant Megyn L Schmitz in court with attorney Ashley J. Morse.  Defendant Megyn L Schmitz in custody.  Daniel Joseph Tolan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  KJB- Clerk. 1:07pm WTL. Clerk to put in 30 day review for scheduling a PH. 1:15pm adj.
